comments: This course is an introduction to current syntactic theory, covering the principles that govern phrase structure, movement, and binding. The majority of the course focuses on the English language while taking examples from other languages to explore certain topics discussed during the semester.  Students reported that the course material was very interesting. Students also claimed that the material for this course was presented in a way that simplified complex ideas in the field.  Most students praised Professor Santorini’s knowledge and presentation of the subject. Other students wrote that Professor Santorini was very good at simplifying the complex aspects of her subject in order to help students understand them. Additionally, the professor was described as “approachable” and “helpful”.  This course was formerly numbered LING 150 and is identical in content. This course is not listed as fulfilling any major college requirements. In addition, there are no prerequisites listed. The course is open to both college freshmen and upperclassmen.
